website_summaries.verdict: The Merrell Bare Access Flex 2 received positive comments from the majority of the users. They admired the shoe’s feather-like feel, impressive ground contact, and its durable construction. Though some found the toe-box to be too wide for them, it still does not affect the positive rating the shoe received.This neutral road running shoe is a good option for those who are looking for a running partner that has minimal cushioning yet durable and flexible enough to provide a more natural experience.
pros: Many users admired the lightweight built of the Merrell Bare Access Flex 2
This road running shoe is very affordable
Several users were happy with how comfortable the shoe is
A few buyers lauded the stylish design of the shoe
They said it looks nice and appealing
Some satisfied wearers commented that the shoe is well-made
A significant number of runners said the Bare Access Flex 2 offers excellent arch support
According to some user reviews, aside from running, the shoe is also comfortable and reliable enough for long walks
A couple of users noted that the outsole design of the shoe is durable and grippy enough for both road and light trail surfaces
cons: Some users were unhappy with the toe-box
They said it is way too large for their feet

customer_reviews.title: I loved them, now I hate them. They smell bad!
customer_reviews.text: These were great, fit perfectly, with cool elastic laces. In the product information, it says they are oder free. I got caught in one quick shower whilst walking home, and since then, they just smell. I have tried a few 'online suggestions' to clean them, plus a few washing machine attempts, but still they are not good. I just leave them outside as much as possible now. It's a pity, as I prefer Merrell barefoot shoes as I am so tall.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE SLIM

customer_reviews.title: Light as a feather
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the work commute. Comfy, extremely light and don't overheat, although not waterproof. Only small criticism is that that they have a wider than most footprint, across the toes, making them look a little out of shape. Others may have other views.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Tub Time Machine

customer_reviews.title: Very light with roomy toebox but with unnecessarily tight midfoot and heel
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very light and have a roomy toebox for the minimal experience. But have a very unnecessarily tight midfoot and heel, which really bothers me. When this is coupled with the unnecessary arch support, it really begins to press into your foot. I find this paradoxical, as if you are in need of a wide toebox, you'll also have a wider midfoot. The upper lining feels cheap and is not very breathable.
customer_reviews.author: Conrado del Foxe

customer_reviews.title: Merrell size 11
customer_reviews.text: All Merrell size 11's fit me perfectly, I have three pairs I regularly wear. These are lightweight and comfortable. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Berlinsessions

customer_reviews.title: Getting better but not quite perfect yet
customer_reviews.text: Great shape and sole. Good natural fit with some support and cushioning. Upper isn't quite right yet, material seems as if it has been recycled from a 90s ford upholstery. Bit stiff and struggled to get a good fit around the ankle. Definitely a good shoe, hopeful Merrell can finally get it right in the 3rd iteration, as it offers a great mid way between barefoot and standard trail shoes.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Lush
customer_reviews.text: Proper cush sweet trainers, cannot wait to gan radg in these there dead comfy and look proper mint
customer_reviews.author: Richy

customer_reviews.title: Squeekiest shoes ever
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so comfortable and great for walking on carpet or grass. However if you walk on any type of hard surface the soles squeek like crazy! They drive me mad.
customer_reviews.author: simon

customer_reviews.title: Great zero drop
customer_reviews.text: Brought for work as I am on my feet for 10 hours a day. Really like them and the zero drop aspect however the upper material is very stiff and dated. Great for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: More of the same
customer_reviews.text: Had previous version of these and they are super comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Ali A.

customer_reviews.title: Really nice trainer/shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, feel quite flat so not hugely supported and take some getting used to but now really like them
customer_reviews.author: neil king

customer_reviews.title: Like feet clouds.
customer_reviews.text: Comfiest trainers in the world for my wide, paddle like feet. May buy a spare pair just in case they stop manufacturing them.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony R Coleclough

customer_reviews.title: Good trainers but .....
customer_reviews.text: The third pair of trainers I bought always good as their wide fit is what I’m after. The only downside is they are expensive so you have to shop around.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Sizing doesn't match.
customer_reviews.text: Quality looks good, but sizing is much smaller than expected. Order at least 1 size up. Ordered twice but had to return, got quick refunds.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Nice barefoot shoes
customer_reviews.text: Fit very well and looks good for a barefoot shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Sergiu

customer_reviews.title: Cheap feeling materials
customer_reviews.text: Although the toe box was wide the shoe was too narrow across the middle. Even if they did fit I wouldn't have kept these because they feel very cheap. The materials surely wouldn't hold up for long.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Gibbs

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Bare Access Flex 2 Fitness Shoes
product_meta.description: Neutral trainer features: shock-absorbing cushioning foam for comfort and durability during high intensity activity. Features: mesh upper traditional lace closure integrated foot bed flexconnect dual-directional flex-groove eva midsole for agility and stability Merrell barefoot 2 construction for enhanced proprioception and stability during variable movement hyper lock tpu film heel counter for security m select fresh antimicrobial agents reduces shoe odour breathable mesh lining moulded nylon arch shank compression moulded eva midsole for stability and comfort vibram Tc5+ stack height (heel/toe): 14.5/14.5 mm; foot bed: 0 mm; insole: 3 mm; midsole: 8/8 mm; sole: 1.5 mm web, 2 mm lug.
feature_bullets: Mesh Upper and Lining- Allows air to penetrate the fabric for a cool, comfortable environment.
M-Select FRESH- Antimicrobial agents reduce shoe odour for a fresher for longer feeling.
Hyperlock TPU Film Heel Counter- Locked-in, secure feel.
Traditional Lace Up System- Adjustable fit for added security.
Compression Moulded EVA Midsole- Stability, agility, and comfort, providing comfort through the gait cycle.
